main event: A UFO-like object was sighted in Medford, Oregon on December 6, 1956, described as a round white object with a streamer traveling north for about five seconds. The report concludes that the sighting was likely caused by a meteor, based on the description, duration, and flight path of the object.
interesting points: The sighting lasted only five seconds, indicating a brief but impactful observation.
The object was described as a round white object with a streamer, suggesting unique characteristics.
The report mentions that the flight path of the object was along the horizon, adding to the mystery of the observation.
The sighting was made by a civilian observer, lending credibility to the report.
The weather conditions at the time of the sighting included a broken ceiling at 15,000 ft and unlimited visibility, providing clear atmospheric details.
